results.title: The Many faces of epilepsy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speaking from experience”.
Epilepsy affects 3% of the Australian population and manifests itself in many different ways to individuals, families and communities. Epilepsy sufferers and their families discuss the symptoms they experience (varying from stumbling, absent seizures, tonic clonic), the success/failure and side effects of medication, reaction to diagnosis, what it feels like to have a seizure (daydreaming, contortion, deja vu), how the symptoms change with age, warning signs, the impact on employment and relationships, disclosure and impact on lifestyle.

results.title: Epilepsy in childhood
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speaking from experience”.
Parents and children discuss the circumstances and behaviour that led to their child being diagnosed with epilepsy, ranging from seizures to staring into space. They explain their very personal initial reaction to the news, deciding whether to medicate or not, the importance of a good relationship with medical staff, the impact on family and friends, schooling, lifestyle changes, and how their children have changed with age and on receiving medication.

results.title: Living with breast cancer
results.creator_credit: Gillian Fawcett, Giovanna Pignaiosa, Anti Cancer Council, Cancer Council Victoria and Speaking From Experience
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speaking from experience”.
Breast cancer is a malignant tumor in the breast. The severity of the disease depends on the size of the cancer and whether it has spread to other parts of the body. This excellent and informative documentary presents five women of varying age, who have all experienced the trauma of breast cancer. Each woman relates her own personal story from the initial diagnosis and having to deal with the reality, to surgery and treatment and finally to recovery and the future. Various types of surgery, chemotherapy, and radiotherapy are discussed including the side effects, physical and emotional, and the important role self-image can play in the road to recovery. Also stresses that the key to recovery is through support from family and friends in terms of encouragement, offers of help in daily routines, and generally in just being there. A common factor with each of the women is the way their outlook on life has changed, valuing each day as precious and maintaining a positive attitude as a means to coping with the disease. A warm and enlightening progam.

group_siblings.title: Alzheimer's disease and other dementias: Diagnosis = Speaking from experience
Grief, trauma and sexual abuse: the stories of two women

results.title: Grief, trauma and sexual abuse: the stories of two women
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speaking from experience”.
Aimed at increasing awareness and consciousness of the crimes depicted, this episode from the “Speaking from experience” series looks at the experiences of Lucy and Tina. Lucy was sexually abused by her father as a young child; a situation that the remainder of her family was aware of. Tina was raped by an unknown assailant in her own home, a country property out of Melbourne. Both women speak candidly and honestly to varying degrees of detail about what happened to them, how they coped immediately afterwards and now, the impact it had on the rest of their family as well as intimate relationships, the benefits of talk therapy, the need for justice, and what has to be achieved to assist the healing process.

results.title: Alzheimer's disease and other dementias: Diagnosis = Speaking from experience
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speaking from experience”.
This Australian program presents a sensitive account of Alzheimer’s disease from the point of view of their families and carers. It looks at the early signs and behaviours, and the ways in which the patients and their carers handle diagnosis of the condition. The emotional impact this disease has on families is openly discussed, as well as practical advice given on how carers can best handle the progression of the condition.

results.title: The X-files = The X files
results.brief_description: Chris Carter’s long running cult series which explores the paranormal and the paranoid, introduced us to the covert world of FBI agents Dana Scully (Gillian Anderson) and Fox Mulder (David Duchovney) and its now famous mantra, “The truth is out there.”

group_works.title: X-files = X files. Season 2. Box set
X-Files = X files. Season 3. Box set [DVD]
X-files = X files. Season 4. Box set
X-files = X files. Season 5. Box set

results.title: X-files = X files. Season 5. Box set
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The X-files = The X files”.
The last season of the X-files ended with the shock suicide of Agent Mulder (David Duchovny). Is this the end of the X-files? Is Mulder really dead? Season 5 opens with a 2 part episode (eps. 1 & 2, Redux) which answers these questions (of course Mulder is not dead!) and also brings to light the mystery surrounding Scully’s fatal cancer. The writers don’t disappoint as Mulder discovers a secret research facility that may hold the cure to Scully’s illness, which also leads him to some revelations about his abducted sister. There are many surprises in stall for Scully and Mulder in season 5, including a mystery child who may or may not be Scully’s daughter (ep. 6, Christmas Carol) and the sudden appearance of an old flame of agent Mulder’s, played by Mimi Rogers (ep. 20, The End). By this stage “The X-files” was enjoying enormous popularity, winning fresh fans and critical praise. The series popularity even drew novelists William Gibson (ep. 11, Kill switch) and Stephen King (ep. 10, Chinga) in to write for the show. Aside form bringing humour into the mix again (ep. 12, Bad blood, ep. 3, Unusual suspects), the creators began to experiment with the show’s form, including an episode shot entirely in black and white (ep. 5, The Post-modern prometheus). “The X-files” also achieved a first for television by having the end of the season continue onto the big screen (X-files the movie: Fight the future). This was untested ground in that viewers would have to see the movie if they wanted to find out the answers to the cliffhanger ending of the season. There’s even a nice self-referential joke in season 5 with the appearance of Darren McGavin (ep. 15, Travelers) from “The Night Stalker”, the show that originally inspired Chris Carter to create “The X-files.” Cast includes: David Duchovny, Gillian Anderson, Mitch Pileggi, Nicholas Lea, William B. Davis.

results.title: X-files = X files. Season 2. Box set
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The X-files = The X files”.
Season one of “The X-Files” concluded with the government shutting down the X-files project leaving agents Dana Scully (Gillian Anderson) and Fox Mulder (David Duchovny) relieved of their special duties. At the commencement of Season two (Ep. 1 ‘Little green men’) Scully and Mulder have been deliberately kept apart by unknown government forces and are back doing rank and file FBI investigations. Believing that the agency keeps them under constant surveillance, Scully and Mulder must now meet in secret. Agent Mulder has lost hope in ever finding ‘the truth’ behind his sisters alien abduction, while agent Scully has become despondent with her extra-ordinary FBI teaching duties. Of course that doesn’t last and the two find themselves together again investigating a recent UFO sighting in Puerto Rico which the government is desperately trying to cover up. The second season delves even deeper into the mythologies set up in season one, accumulating with agent Scully’s abduction (Ep. 5 ‘Duane Barry’) and agent Mulder discovering some shocking revelations about his sister’s disappearance (Ep. 16 ‘Colony’). In season two creator Chris Carter creates a nice role reversal between the agents, as the scientifically minded Scully begins to entertain the existence of extraterrestrial life, while Mulder begins to lose interest in finding out the ‘truth’. Season two also sees the introduction of Krycek (Nicholas Lea), a duplicitous FBI agent who is initially assigned as Mulder’s partner when Scully goes missing (Ep. 4 ‘Sleepless’). Cast also includes William B. Davis and Mitch Pileggi.

group_siblings.title: X-Files = X files. Season 3. Box set [DVD]
X-files = X files. Season 4. Box set
X-files = X files. Season 5. Box set

results.title: X-files = X files. Season 4. Box set
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The X-files = The X files”.
The X-Files opening credit mantra up until now has been, ‘the truth is out there’. With the commencement of season four, this has ominously changed to ‘everything dies.’ This foreboding phrase, spoken by the murderous alien bounty hunter that Mulder and Scully were pursuing at the end of season three, resonates throughout the fourth season. The uneasy sense of darker things to come commences in episode one (Ep. 1 ‘Herrenvolk’) with Mulder’s mother still in a life threatening coma and the murder of the agent’s government informant; the mysterious X. The dread soon begins to accumulate with the return of Krycek and the parasitic alien black oil (Ep. 9 ‘Tunguska’). However, the biggest shock the season has in store is Scully discovering she has cancer that might also be related to her abduction (Ep. 15 ‘Memento Mori’). Season four saw the show at the height of its popularity with its biggest US ratings so far, even surpassing die hard fans’ expectations with some of the most creepiest episodes of the series (Ep. 3 ‘Home’ ; Ep. 2 ‘Unruhe’ ; Ep. 4 ‘Teliko’ ; Ep. 14 ‘Leonard Betts’) and its most compelling (Ep. 15 ‘Memento Mori’ ; Ep. 13 ‘Never again’ ; Ep. 24 ‘Gethsemane’). Cast includes: Gillian Anderson, David Duchovny, William B. Davis, Mitch Pileggi, Nicholas Lea.

With the commencement of season four, this has ominously changed to ‘everything dies.’ This foreboding phrase, spoken by the murderous alien bounty hunter that Mulder and Scully were pursuing at the end of season three, resonates throughout the fourth season. The uneasy sense of darker things to come commences in episode one (Ep. 1 ‘Herrenvolk’) with Mulder’s mother still in a life threatening coma and the murder of the agent’s government informant; the mysterious X. The dread soon begins to accumulate with the return of Krycek and the parasitic alien black oil (Ep. 9 ‘Tunguska’). However, the biggest shock the season has in store is Scully discovering she has cancer that might also be related to her abduction (Ep. 15 ‘Memento Mori’). Season four saw the show at the height of its popularity with its biggest US ratings so far, even surpassing die hard fans’ expectations with some of the most creepiest episodes of the series (Ep. 3 ‘Home’ ; Ep. 2 ‘Unruhe’ ; Ep. 4 ‘Teliko’ ; Ep. 14 ‘Leonard Betts’) and its most compelling (Ep. 15 ‘Memento Mori’ ; Ep. 13 ‘Never again’ ; Ep. 24 ‘Gethsemane’). Cast includes: Gillian Anderson, David Duchovny, William B. Davis, Mitch Pileggi, Nicholas Lea.

results.title: X-Files = X files. Season 3. Box set [DVD]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The X-files = The X files”.
With season three of the X-Files, creator Chris Carter and his team of writers introduce an unexpected element into the show’s formula - humour. Having built a loyal fanbase of ‘X-philes’, the show begins to confidently toy with expectations, offering sly takes on classic American ‘drive-in’ movies (Ep. 12 ‘War of the Coprophages,’ which also teases the audience and Scully with a Mulder love interest named Bambi), to all-out self parody (Ep. 20 ‘Jose Chung’s From outer space’.) However, Carter doesn’t allow the series to slip entirely into send-up, remaining faithful to what originally drew the fans in - the ‘mythology’ episodes. At the commencement of season 3 (Ep. 1 ‘The Blessing way’) Mulder is missing, presumed dead, after the ‘cigarette-smoking man’ ordered the destruction of a train carriage that he was hiding in at the end of series 2. Scully on the other hand is convinced Mulder is still alive. Of course, Mulder shows up eventually and before too long the two are reunited, but this time their investigations are of a more personal nature. Mulder wanting to avenge his father’s death at the end of season 2, while Scully experiences her own family tragedy (Ep. 2 ‘Paper clip.’) These two tragic losses ultimately strengthen the bond between the agents; needing to depend even more on each others strength and trust. Season 3 provides plenty of other challenges for the FBI agents as they encounter old foes, (Krycek makes an unwelcome appearance) and uncover a secret government plot that will ultimately shed light on Scully’s abduction (Ep. 9 “Nisei”). Cast includes: Gillian Anderson, David Duchovny, Mitch Pileggi, William B. Davis, Nicholas Lea.
